dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2210 IS: Unlocking Benefits for Independent Workers Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cassidy (for himself, Mr. Tuberville, Mr. Scott of South Carolina, and Mr. Budd) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To ensure that the provision of portable benefits to an individual is not considered in determining whether such individual is an employee of a person, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Unlocking Benefits for Independent Workers Act.

section.header: Consideration of portable benefits with respect to employment status
section.text: A determination whether an individual is an employee of a person for the purposes of any Federal law shall be made without considering whether such person provides to the individual—

paragraph.text: a benefit or protection that the individual may maintain without regard to whether the individual continues to perform work for such person;
a benefit or protection of a type that is commonly provided to a full-time employee;
a contribution, financial or otherwise, with respect to a benefit described in paragraph (1) or (2) that is—

subparagraph.text: made on behalf of the individual by the person in connection with work performed by the individual for the person; or

paragraph.text: a benefit, protection, or contribution that is a combination of any benefit, protection, or contribution described in paragraph (1), (2), or (3).
